metadata.title: CVE-2018-14665 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in xorg-x11-server before 1.20.3. An incorrect permissioncheck for -modulepath and -logfile options when starting Xorg. X serverallows unprivileged users with the ability to log in to the system viaphysical console to escalate their privileges and run arbitrary code underroot privileges.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14665` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.8
xdmx-tools - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.8
xmir - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.8
xnest - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.8
xorg-server-source - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.8
xserver-common - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.8
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.8
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.8
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.8
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.8
xvfb - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.8
xwayland - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.8
No subscription required

xmir-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.2
xorg-server-source-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.2
xserver-xephyr-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.2
xserver-xorg-core-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.2
xserver-xorg-legacy-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.2
xwayland-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.8').
xorg-server-hwe-16.04 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.2').
